page.title: 08SALISBURY-LEISURE IN 1985
page.content: In Salisbury there are many opportunities for leisure activities with clubs representing a score of different sports and games;the library and various day and evening courses offered at the Technical College. The Tourist Information office can give you details. There are two popular amusement arcades. You need at least Â£1 to enjoy them. Salisbury has 5 parks with children's play areas, and four sports fields. The rivers Nadder, Avon and Bourne, used by rowers, anglers and sea scouts run through the city. The swimming pool and sports centres are popular with residents; gliding and horse riding may be enjoyed on the outskirts, although Salisbury's locals generally prefer a change of scenery at holiday time.
